meta.content: For general inquiries, contact the Ascension Parish School Board Office. Phone: 225.391.7000 or 225.257.2000 Physical & Mailing Address: 1100 Webster Street Donaldsonville, LA 70346

meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Louisiana, schools, public school, education, k-12, early head start, primary, secondary, middle school,

div.p: Ascension Public Schools is working hard to respond to the challenges around COVID-19 and continue to serve children. No one ever chooses to be in a crisis, but we are all grateful to partner with you, the Ascension Parish community, during this challenge. Click here for the latest information and resources. >>

div.class: col-md-7 col-sm-7 col-logo-bar col-xs-7 social-links gray

div.div:
Dear Ascension Public Schools Families,
We thank all of you for another great week of learning. I was able to visit middle school and high school Zoom classrooms this week. It was a great experience! Our students were attentive and active in learning. Teachers were prompting students to think critically, solve problems, predict, and anticipate relative to course content; and students successfully met those challenges. It truly was awesome!
Just a quick reminder, Interim Grades are available for your review today. Also remember, you are viewing an Interim Grade that is a measure of the real progress your child has made during Quarter 4. But keep in mind, this Quarter 4 measure will NOT become official unless it is better than your child’s overall average prior to March 13. Even though there are no official consequences associated with the work of children during this unexpected season of distance learning, there could be unofficial consequences next school year. We are confident we can avoid those unofficial consequences if your child stays engaged in learning throughout the remainder of this school year.
On another note, I know there are many questions you may have regarding the closing of a school year and the events that go along with the spring semester. Listed below are some of those events:
Honoring our Graduates – Our high school principals and district leaders have been in discussion the past few weeks about alternatives and possibilities for graduation ceremonies. We all agree that graduation is perhaps the most significant event that a school system hosts each year. We are committed to honoring this milestone accomplishment in the lives of our Class of 2020 and providing them with the appropriate recognition and fanfare that they all deserve. Next week, we expect to hear more from our Governor with respect to guidelines for the days and weeks ahead. This guidance will help us better anticipate the type of event we might be able to host in the weeks or months ahead. Please be patient. We want to give our seniors the best possible end to their K-12 journey. Waiting for more details about the future will allow us to better prepare with confidence. Our goal is to provide you with information regarding our plans for graduation by the end of next week.
Other Award Events for All Schools – We will be working with each school to support their efforts to properly conduct routine award ceremonies for students. Each school principal will be communicating these efforts in the next week or two. Many already have conducted online honors recognitions, and end-of-year recognitions may follow the same path. However, it is possible that some ceremonies may be postponed until the fall.
Board Recognitions such as Teachers of the Year, Principals of the Year, Outstanding Support Persons of the Year, and Special Olympians – We will definitely honor these outstanding professionals and students at an upcoming Ascension Parish School Board meeting when gatherings are allowed again. However, we realize this may be as late as the fall.
Teacher and Staff Appreciations – Each spring, our school communities do an outstanding job of making our teachers and staff feel appreciated for the work that they do. We will be working with schools and those support groups that serve schools to find appropriate and creative ways to honor our teachers and staff.
Closing Schools and Returning Resources – We know that at some point in May, we will need to arrange a way to collect resources. That could include non-consumable instructional resources such as books and certainly includes computing devices. We use the summertime to re-image, update, and prepare thousands of devices so that they operate at full capacity at the start of the next school year. We will be providing you with detailed information in early May regarding logistics for that effort.
Although this does not answer all of the questions you may have for closing out the 2019-20 school year, please understand that we are working hard to make decisions in the best interests of our students while remaining compliant with the guidelines, restrictions, and overall interest of public health. Thank you, as always, for your patience, understanding, and support. Enjoy your weekend, and we look forward to connecting again with you next week.

div.br:
David Alexander
Superintendent
Ascension Public Schools

div.p: We thank all of you for another great week of learning. I was able to visit middle school and high school Zoom classrooms this week. It was a great experience! Our students were attentive and active in learning.

Ascension Parish School Board Office

hr.p: Contact the Louisiana Legislative Auditor (LLA) Hotline, www.lla.la.gov/report-fraud, if you suspect the misappropriation (theft), fraud, waste, or abuse of public funds by anyone.

div.p: This website is maintained by the Ascension Parish School Board. Some files and links on this site require Adobe Reader or Adobe Flash Player to open, view or print. If anyone is unable to access pages or content on a webpage, please contact our webmaster at webmaster@apsb.org or 225-391-7145. To file a formal grievance under Section 504 and Title II related to accessibility visit https://www.apsb.org/page/section504. | The district is not responsible for facts or opinions contained on any linked site. | It is the policy of the Ascension Parish School Board to provide equal opportunities without regard to race, color, national origin, sex, age, disabilities, or veteran status in its educational programs and activities. This includes, but is not limited to, admissions, educational services, financial aid, and employment. | The district and its schools are nationally accredited by AdvancED.
